{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3526460,"name":"Luiz Guilherme Forest Gomes ","username":"Forest_gomes","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/ee59a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-13T21:12:31.458Z","cooked":"

We have four neo motors, each one is controlled by one SparkMax. We’re trying to limit te current to 60A on the motors with the rev client, but it always come back to 80A. Is there any way to limit the current in the codes?

Are you using the Burn button at the bottom of the page? That one should save the settings to the flash.

Yeah, we did it a few times, but it always comes back to 80A

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-02-13T21:49:13.683Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":128,"readers_count":127,"score":30.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":491595,"topic_slug":"current-limiting-with-spark-max","display_username":"Luiz Guilherme Forest Gomes ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":50699,"username":"Programming4907","name":"Scott W","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/programming4907/{size}/168313_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68229,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/current-limiting-with-spark-max/491595/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3526524,"name":"Dan","username":"tekdemo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-13T22:23:05.904Z","cooked":"

It’s probably worth noting that 80a is the “default”. Which means, if you configure the motors using kResetSafeParameters , but your configuration doesn’t set them to not 80A, they will reset back to 80A.

There’s functionally two solutions here:

  • Write your configuration using kNoResetSafeParameters, preserving the setting you set via the rev tool.
  • Setting the current limit in the configuration api in code

The second one is typically the better approach, since it ensures that your code contains a fully defined configuration in case you have to swap out that motor controller down the line.

Yes most certainly set it in the code and use the “persist parameters” function thing to make sure it stays there. My team has horror stories of not setting all the stuff on these things in the code and having the robot come to life with backwards motor inversion status’!

For SparkMaxes you -really- need to write code to check that your sparkmaxes are set up the way you intend, and re-try the flash if they are not set right.

There are weird race conditions in the parameter setting…

How exactly do i set the current limit in the configuration api in code? I really didn’t find anything about this.

Can you explain how i do it in the code? I’ve been searching in the documentation, but i really didn’t find anything?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-02-15T17:10:26.145Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":44,"readers_count":43,"score":33.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":491595,"topic_slug":"current-limiting-with-spark-max","display_username":"Luiz Guilherme Forest Gomes ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":56643,"username":"aveeser","name":"4391 Programming Mentor","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/3da27b/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68229,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/current-limiting-with-spark-max/491595/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3528191,"name":"4391 Programming Mentor","username":"aveeser","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/3da27b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-15T20:46:32.682Z","cooked":"

m_WinchMotor = new SparkMax(WinchConstants.kWinchMtrID, MotorType.kBrushless);
m_WinchMotorConfig = new SparkMaxConfig();

// Setting some of the major settings for the Spark Max Configuration
m_WinchMotorConfig.idleMode(IdleMode.kBrake);
m_WinchMotorConfig.inverted(WinchConstants.kWinchMtrInverted);
m_WinchMotorConfig.closedLoopRampRate(WinchConstants.kWinchMtrRampRate);
m_WinchMotorConfig.openLoopRampRate(WinchConstants.kWinchMtrRampRate);
m_WinchMotorConfig.smartCurrentLimit(WinchConstants.kWinchMtrCurrentLimit);

// Finally send the configuration into the Spark Max Motor Controller.
m_WinchMotor.configure(m_WinchMotorConfig, ResetMode.kResetSafeParameters, PersistMode.kPersistParameters);

Here’s an example of how we go about setting major settings on spark max. Smart current limit is the one you’re specifically looking for I think. After setting everything, save all settings to flash with the “configure” part.
